programme.desc: 13/26. Abi Reid from Stirlingshire is Joy's guest, and Calum Maclean is in Islay visiting a distillery.

programme.title: An L
programme.desc: Naidheachdan ionadail, niseanta is eadar-niseanta gach l cuide ri fiosrachadh coimhearsnachd bho BBC ALBA. Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: Miann na Maighdinn-mara/Mermaid Tales
programme.desc: 3/4. Kate looks on as her brother Seumas tests out his speedboat and she learns about a 19th-century shipwreck.

programme.title: A' Cluich 'son a bhith Beo: Von...
programme.desc: ...Cramm v Hitler/Von Cramm v Hitler. 1/2. The incredible story of forgotten tennis star Gottfried von Cramm, who defied the Nazis. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programme.title: Mach a Seo! - An Roinn Eorpa
programme.desc: 3/4. Ramsay takes a trip to Seville in Spain for some winter sun. Ramsay air thuras gu Seville san Spinn.

programme.title: Sruth
programme.desc: 2/8. Cel bho Pdruig Moireasdan, Brd Harper, Phil Coineagan & Megan McGinley. Featuring music from Pdruig Morrison, Brd Harper, Phil Cunningham and Megan McGinley.

programme.title: Transatlantic Sessions: Dluth an Daimh
programme.desc: 6/7. Julie Fowlis presents highlights from two decades of the music show. This episode includes stars Alison Krauss, Sarah Jarosz, Rosanne Cash, Paul Brady and Karen Matheson.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh r bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh r bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: 8/20. Tha 'n aileag air Goraidh gun stad agus tha e feumach air cobhair bhon Treubh. Goraidh has constant hiccups and needs help from the Farmyard Bunch.

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 18/40. Abair g' eil Fuigheag ag adhbharachadh an t-uabhas bhraich an-diugh. Fuigheag is responsible for a lot of mess.

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: 1/26. Biscuit-loving Fox realises he is in bad shape. His friends want to help him to get fit, but he fails at all the exercises they suggest.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: 61/104. Tha Bing a' danamh fiughair ri reiteag. Bing looks forward to an ice cream.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: 62/104. Nuair a thid plst a chur air a' chorrag aig Coco, tha Bing cuideachd ag iarraidh fear. When Coco is given a plaster for a cut, Bing decides that he should also get one.

programme.title: Pompon Am Mathan Beag/Pompon Little Bear
programme.desc: 10/39. Tha Pompon a' cluich "sealg" an-diugh. Pompon plays at 'hunting' today.

programme.title: An Teaghlach Roghail an...

programme.title: An Teaghlach Roghail an...
programme.desc: ...Ath-dhoras/The Royals Next Door. 4/52. Tha oidhche gheamaichean teaghlaich gu bhith ann ach am bi e sprsail? There's going to be a family game night, but will it be fun?

programme.title: A-null 's a-nall
programme.desc: 3/5. Tha an sgoil croiseil airson Ton - saoil am bi fuasgladh ann? School is problematic for Ton, will there be a solution?

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc: 4/12. Alexa a' farpais an aghaidh preasantairean CBBC ALBA. Alexa competes against the CBBC ALBA presenters.

programme.title: Flix
programme.desc: 4/13. Tha L Niseant' nan Con ann is tha Flix airson a chomharrachadh. It's National Dog Day and Flix wants to celebrate it.

programme.title: Machair

programme.title: Fionnlagh
programme.desc: Sgeul beatha Fhionnlaigh J Dhomhnullaich. An affectionate and candid portrait of writer and broadcaster Finlay J MacDonald.

programme.title: Cu Leis Thu? | A Puppy for Padruig
programme.desc: 4/6. Peter is in Argyll and Bute learning about Westies' history and personality. Tha Pdruig ann an Earra-Ghidheal is Bhid ag ionnsachadh mu eachdraidh is ndar nan Westie.

programme.title: Crowdie And Cream/Gruth is Uachdar
programme.desc: 1/3. Drama series based on Finlay J MacDonald's account of life in the Scottish Hebrides in the 1930s. Finlay and his family move to Scarista. An engagement party brings joy and sorrow.

programme.title: Seirm

programme.title: Mafia Corsica: Gnathas Tostachd
programme.desc: 3/4. As banks reinforce their security systems, the days of hold-ups seem to be over. And yet, 'Le Brise de Mer' is about to pull off its biggest heist. Contains some violent scenes.

programme.title: The Srebrenica Tape - Storyville
programme.desc: A woman seeks to find out more about her father, a victim of the 1995 Srebrenica massacre. Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

programme.title: Copa '71: The Lost Lionesses - Storyville
programme.desc: Story of an extraordinary tournament, told through the voices of the women who took part.

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: 6/6. Professor Ben Garrod explores how some snakes can see using heat, how crocodiles feel through their jaws, and how some animals use electricity to navigate their world.

programme.title: War Walks
programme.desc: 6/6. Richard Holmes traces the events of a night of the Blitz, from the sector control room where the incoming raiders were plotted through to the efforts to save St Paul's.

programme.title: Albert Speer: The Nazi Who Said Sorry - Reputations
programme.desc: A look at Albert Speer, Hitler's arms minister. Was his remorse after the war genuine? Contains scenes which some viewers may find disturbing.

programme.title: Simon Schama's Power of Art
programme.desc: 8/8. Mark Rothko believed that tradition was all used up and that figurative art could no longer connect us, viscerally, to the human tragedy. So he set himself - and New York - a test.

programme.title: When Big Things Go Wrong

programme.title: New: My Strange Arrest
programme.desc: A suspect flees from a car chase while carrying her child, state troopers catch a man with a utility pole strapped to his car and a caterer flips out on wedding guests. (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: New: My Strange Arrest
programme.desc: Doorbell Licker: An aspiring rapper is arrested after performing on top of a billboard, while a man is caught licking the doorbell intercom of a home. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: New: My Strange Arrest
programme.desc: Takeout Drugs: A man leads police on a chase in a stolen truck, a restaurant owner is arrested after hiding drugs in a takeout box and a pizza delivery guy helps with an arrest. (S1, ep 11)

programme.title: Alien Disclosure Files
programme.desc: What Lies Below: UAPs have been seen entering the ocean at high speeds - and since our oceans can be as deep as six miles, were the UAPs simply trying to get home? (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Antigravity: Experts discuss the possibility of advanced alien technology that could allow UFOs to fly at blinding speed or hover effortlessly a few feet above the ground. (S3, ep 10)

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: UFO Metal: Nations all over the world are rumoured to have found metal debris from UFO crashes. Join the investigation into the alleged wreckages of otherworldly crafts. (S3, ep 11)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Aliens And Forbidden Islands: Experts investigate why so many UFOs have been spotted near remote islands. Could these far-removed spots be the earthly homes of aliens? (S6, ep 1)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Aliens And The Lost Ark: Theorists investigate whether sought-after religious relic the Ark of the Covenant could hold connections to our extraterrestrial past. (S6, ep 2)

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Middlebank Monster: Fishermen race against time due to the limited fishing schedule of the season, trying to haul in the bluefin tuna despite the risk of high waters. (S10, ep 6)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn: Behind The Deal
programme.desc: Watch Your Back: This was the deal that nearly broke the Golds. Go behind the scenes and find out what really happened when Les allowed a $60,000 watch to walk out the door. (S1, ep 5)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: New. Join antiques expert and presenter David Dickinson as more collectors try to sell their items to dealers. Will they strike a deal or take a chance at auction instead? (S8, ep 67)

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: In 1980, soldiers encounter a luminous craft and dancing red lights in Suffolk. Witnesses report a metallic UFO hovering over water and crashing in Nova Scotia in 1967. (S1, ep 7)

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: In 1980, an Australian rancher witnesses a hovering UFO that shoots out a black tube-like object. A French biologist is left stunned when he spots a saucer-shaped craft in 1982. (S1, ep 11)

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: Teens on a Christian retreat spot an object land on a hill, emitting solid beams of light in 1972. In 1989, two Belgian police officers chase a triangular craft across fields. (S1, ep 12)

programme.title: Alien Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Unwelcome Visitors: If aliens have visited Earth, what are their intentions? Do they wish to experiment on the human body, or the human mind as well? (S4, ep 8)

programme.title: Alien Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Finding Aliens: Advances in technology have given us unprecedented access to distant galaxies that may harbour life. However, alien life may be found closer to home. (S4, ep 10)

programme.title: Alien Files Unsealed
programme.desc: First Contact: As humanity continues to search for alien life, experts give their analysis on how close we are to First Contact. (S4, ep 20)

programme.title: Alien Corridors
programme.desc: Falkirk Triangle: With more than 300 UFO sightings each year, the people living within the Falkirk Triangle can't help but feel uneasy about the strange occurrences. (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: Alien Corridors
programme.desc: California: California is home to numerous sightings of unidentified flying objects. The size of the state is a recipe for explained and unexplained sightings. (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: Accidental Truth: UFO Revelations
programme.desc: Discover never-before-seen truths about UFOs through revelations from those on the inside. Is the truth about another intelligence becoming undeniably clear?

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: UFO Abduction: UFO sightings and claims of alien abduction go hand in hand, but never-before-seen evidence brings new credibility to the alleged alien implants left behind. (S2, ep 3)

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: UFOs vs the Royal Airforce: The Royal Airforce has been encountering UFOs on a regular basis since World War II, but the British government has consistently denied the sightings. (S2, ep 8)

programme.title: UFO Encounters UK
programme.desc: 60 years on, Tony's close encounter has become an obsession. Meanwhile, pilot David presents photographic evidence of the UFO he almost crashed into whilst flying near area 51. (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: UFO Encounters UK
programme.desc: Adam, Gwen and Julie recall personal encounters with UFOs, before experts' theories are put in doubt when we learn that each individual has time missing from their encounters. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.desc: Sleeper: When Phil fails to stay home and wait for the repairman, he tells an elaborate lie to hide the truth from Claire, but the stress is more than he can take.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Message Received: Jay, Gloria and Manny challenge each other to step outside their comfort zone and try something new. Mitch and Cam's wedding is getting too big and costly.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Zeke's: In New Orleans, Gordon Ramsay visits a restaurant famed for its Cajun food and loyal locals. But under new ownership, standards have slipped and the customers have left.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: La Frite: In Los Angeles, Gordon Ramsay visits La Frite, a French restaurant that's being run into the ground by its squabbling family owners.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pygmoelian: After he's snubbed for a Duff beer calendar, Moe goes for plastic surgery and ends up so handsome that he becomes a soap star.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart to the Future: Bart foresees his adult future as a struggling rock guitarist crashing on Ralph Wiggum's couch, while Lisa becomes President.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Uncle Sheldon and a Hormonal Firecracker: Despite the whole family trying to keep it a secret, Sheldon and Missy learn about Georgie's pregnancy.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: White Trash, Holy Rollers and Punching People: The Coopers face judgement from the congregation in the wake of Georgie's pregnancy.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Clean Out Your Junk Drawer: Gloria wins a bid at the school auction for a family seminar with famous doctor and self-help book author Debra Radcliffe.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: White Christmas: In an attempt to have the perfect white Christmas that she never had in Colombia, Gloria rents a cabin in the mountains for the whole family.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Ispy: Claire and Phil decide to spy on Luke and Manny when they're hanging out with one of their more questionable friends.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Positive Negative Reaction: When Bernadette makes a big announcement, Howard becomes convinced that he needs to start earning more money.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Celebration Experimentation: The gang persuade Sheldon to celebrate his birthday and invite a few special guests along to his party, in the 200th episode.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Application Deterioration: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard run into problems when they file for a patent. Emily reaches out to Raj after their break-up.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Legalese and a Whole Hoo-Ha: Sheldon's database invention puts him at odds with the university. And the church takes issue with Meemaw's video store.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: College Dropouts and the Medford Miracle: Sheldon considers dropping out of college to focus on building his database.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Man Shouldn't Lie: Claire brings home a stray dog and gets the kids to help her hide it. And Cameron rents out the upstairs apartment to a Christian rock band.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Promposal: With Closet-Con imminent, Claire's on high alert and convinced there's a company mole. Phil goes vigilante when he and Gloria confront Alice for stealing her recipe.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Large Marge: Marge accidentally gets breast implants after mistakenly thinking that Homer was flirting with two businesswomen while he was building houses for the homeless.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Helter Skelter: The Simpsons' house must be fumigated after a hockey player gives Lisa his termite-infested stick. The only place they can find to live is in a reality TV show.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Veracity Elasticity: Leonard is upset when he finds out that Penny has been moving his collectables out of Sheldon's old room and into storage behind his back.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Brain Bowl Incubation: Sheldon tries to convince Amy that they should procreate. Raj feels embarrassed about what the new woman in his life does for a living.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Geology Elevation: Sheldon can't contain his jealousy when he hears that his university colleague, Bert the geologist, has won a prestigious fellowship.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bonfire of the Manatees: Marge meets a handsome marine biologist (guest star Alec Baldwin). Will he woo her? Can Homer win her back?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Strong Arms of the Ma: When Marge is mugged, she reacts by working out with weights, but goes too far and ends up as a steroid-crazed bully.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brake My Wife, Please: When Homer is banned from driving, Marge gets stressed ferrying everyone around, but Homer enjoys walking everywhere - until Marge crashes into him.

programme.title: New: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Brand new series - The Perfect Storm: A catastrophic storm exposes a major leak and brings chaos to the boat. The stews voice their frustrations over a deckhand.

programme.title: White House Down
programme.desc: (2013) All-American action thriller starring Channing Tatum and Jamie Foxx. A Capitol police officer steps up to protect the President when the White House is compromised.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: The Quiet Girl
programme.desc: (2022) Colm Bairad's poignant drama about a little girl who's sent away from home to live with distant family in rural Ireland. Based on Claire Keegan's novella Foster. In Gaelic/subs.

programme.title: Escape from Mogadishu
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller based on a true story about South and North Korean diplomats working together to escape Somalia's capital during the coup of 1991. In Korean and Somali/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Bravados
programme.desc: (1958) Brooding western starring Joan Collins and Gregory Peck. A man hunts down the four escaped prisoners who he believes are responsible for the murder of his wife.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: (1954) Oscar-nominated Humphrey Bogart, in one of his finest roles, stars in Edward Dmytryk's gripping drama as Captain Philip Queeg, in charge of a US Navy minesweeper during the war.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: (1967) Julie Christie and Terence Stamp star in John Schlesinger's adaptation of Thomas Hardy's novel. Bathsheba is not short of suitors, but will marrying any of them lead to happiness?

programme.title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: (2009) Action adventure with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston. Terrorists steal a devastating weapon and only the USA's finest - the GI Joes - can stop them.

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: (2009) Michael Mann directs Johnny Depp as infamous bank robber John Dillinger; Marion Cotillard as Dillinger's sorta girl; and Christian Bale as the FBI agent trying to put him away.

programme.title: The Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: (1992) Action adventure starring Daniel Day-Lewis and Madeleine Stowe. Can a frontiersman protect two British women from the brutality of the 18th-century American colonial wars?

programme.title: Les Misrables
programme.desc: (2019) Ladj Ly's oscar-nominated drama, loosely based on his childhood and set in the struggling Parisian suburbs of Montfermeil during the 2018 riots. In French/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Outcast of the Islands
programme.desc: (1951) Director Carol Reed's drama. A disgraced trader finds a new life in a secretive trading village. However, his own greed soon brings trouble. With Trevor Howard and Ralph Richardson.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: (1954) Tough western. A cavalry doctor (Robert Francis) discovers a Native American tribe is dying of malaria, but his by-the-book captain (Phil Carey) refuses to allow their treatment.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1956) Historical drama. The Oscar-winning Ingrid Bergman stars as an amnesiac refugee who Yul Brynner tries to pass off as the daughter of the murdered Tsar of Russia, Nicholas II.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: (1989) Star-studded tragi-comedy with Julia Roberts, Daryl Hannah, Dolly Parton and more. Six Southern belles console and cajole each other through life in a Louisiana beauty parlour.

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
programme.desc: (2018) Action crime thriller sequel. Denzel Washington returns as Robert McCall who's looking for revenge after ruthless killers murder an agency contact who he also considered a friend.

programme.title: The Integrity of Joseph Chambers
programme.desc: (2022) Robert Machoian's drama ponders the state of modern masculinity as a cack-handed insurance salesman played by Clayne Crawford heads solo to the woods for a fateful hunting trip.

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: (2008) Action thriller. Liam Neeson stars as a former CIA operative who vows to track down his daughter after she's kidnapped in Paris.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: (1942) Swashbuckling adventure with Laird Cregar and Tyrone Power. Privateer Captain Henry Morgan tries to rid the Caribbean of pirates when he's made Governor of Jamaica. Bit rich.

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: (1944) Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly star in Charles Vidor's Technicolor comedy musical about a chorus girl's rise to fame. Featuring songs and a score from Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: (2004) Sci-fi thriller with Will Smith. In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot. Can he keep an open mind?

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.

programme.title: Attack the Block
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi horror-comedy with John Boyega. Aggressive aliens unwisely pick a tough London housing estate as the beachhead for their invasion. But the locals are no pushovers...

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: The Quiet Girl
programme.desc: (2022) Colm Bairad's poignant drama about a little girl who's sent away from home to live with distant family in rural Ireland. Based on Claire Keegan's novella Foster. In Gaelic/subs.

programme.title: Escape from Mogadishu
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller based on a true story about South and North Korean diplomats working together to escape Somalia's capital during the coup of 1991. In Korean and Somali/subs.

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig in his first appearance as 007. James Bond is awarded his licence to kill and sets off in pursuit of Le Chiffre, a corrupt banker who finances terrorism. Realising that the desperate Le Chiffre needs to win big on the gaming tables of Montenegro to pay off a dangerous client, Bond formulates a plan to ruin him in a high-stakes poker game.

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts Richard about the cost of his actions, he agrees to a plan to divert the police's attention from Thomas. With Max in hospital following the fallout of the night prior, Thomas meets with Fanny who reveals a dark secret. Mystery thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Dervla Kirwan and Richard Graves

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a sea bass ceviche using a variety of unusual herbs, and chef Lesley Waters shares her beef stroganoff recipe. The host also reveals how to make the ultimate chicken pie, and treats DJ Jordan North, etiquette expert William Hanson, and chefs Richard Berlinet, Ashley Palmer-Watts and Dipna Anand to steak

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Jane and Mick from Chesterfield, multilingual Bilal and husband Joe from London, and couple Scarlett and Walter from London try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Iceland v Finland (Kick-off 5.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the opening match of the tournament, as the Group A rivals meet at Arena Thun in Switzerland. Iceland are playing in their fifth consecutive Euros finals, with their best showing coming in 2013 when they reached the last eight. Finland reached the semi-finals on their tournament debut in 2005 and were quarter-finalists four years later, but have not won a match in their two appearances since then in 2013 and three years ago

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon tells Paddy he needs to start facing up to reality, Jacob comforts Sarah, and Vinny is awkward around Kammy

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin heads to the hospital for his results without Abi, Maria frets when Gary misses Liam's birthday celebration, Alya gets wind of Dee-Dee's devious plan, and Bernie orders Brody to make amends with his mum

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show hosted by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts the real Alexis, lies unravel as the truth about what happened to Vinca on that night 25 years ago is revealed. When deadly consequences arise, Thomas struggles with what his return and obsession with Vinca has done to his friends and family. Manon and Pianelli question whether justice has been served

programme.desc: James cooks Korean-inspired dishes of lamb chop and mackerel, chef Chantelle Nicholson shares a delicious recipe for stuffed courgette flowers. The host also reveals how to make the perfect meringues while also treating singer Alfie Boe to a mouth-watering chicken Kyiv

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a dish of roasted pineapple, ice cream and doughnuts while chatting to a man inspired to set up his own doughnut company when his children were diagnosed with food allergies. Chef Asma Khan provides authentic Indian cookery, and Lorraine Kelly and Marti Pellow are treated to an Arbroath smoked haddock omelette

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mad and Josh, a mother and son from Oxford, Chelmsford twins Prabin and Pallavi, and Gail and Genny, a mother and daughter from Belfast try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sarah from Altrincham, Jack from Sheffield, Ellie from Bedfordshire and Mo from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Portugal (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group B, held at Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. These rivals met twice this year in April in the UEFA Nations League and world champions Spain won 4-2 way and 7-1 at home to demonstrate why they were the pre-tournament favourites to win this trophy. However, they were eliminated by hosts England in the quarter-finals three years ago and their best showing in the competition remains a third-place finish in 1997. Portugal are making their third consecutive appearance in the finals having never previously qualified, but were eliminated in the group stage in both 2017 and 2022

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: When a helpless baby boy was found in Milton Keynes in 1984, staff at a nearby hospital named him after the royal baby born just a few weeks earlier. 'Harry' was adopted and raised as Jon, but he is still haunted by the mystery of his start in life, and so is foundling Tina, who was left outside a hospital in Stoke-on-Trent in 1970. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help the duo find out more about their respective families

programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by TV and radio presenter Lisa Snowdon, who ejnoys a hearty breakfast naan filled with bacon and a masala egg, Jimmy makes the most of old jeans to create an unusual feeder for the coatis at the wildlife park, and plant expert Stephan demonstrates the Japanese art of kokedama

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vets
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Geraldine and Paul from Leeds, husband and wife Patrick and Bukky from Sheffield, and spouses Stu and Kate from Wigan use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Denmark v Sweden (Kick-off 5.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Stade de Genve in Switzerland. The Scandinavian rivals were also in the same UEFA Nations League group, with Sweden winning 2-1 in Odense in February and then claiming an emphatic 6-1 victory just a month ago in Solna. They will be looking to build on that fine form as they aim to emulate their triumph in the inaugural tournament in 1984, having reached at least the quarter-finals in every staging they have qualified for since without adding another trophy to their cabinet. The Danes will look to bounce back from their recent setbacks and enjoy a tournament at least as productive as their 2017 showing in the Netherlands, when they were runners-up to the hosts

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Germany v Poland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. Germany will be looking to go one better than in 2022, when they were runners-up to hosts in England, and they go into this tournament in excellent form, having comfortably topped their UEFA Nations League group. Their opponents are playing in their first major championship, but they too go into this competition on the back of some good results in 2025, albeit without facing anyone of the calibre of the Germans. Denmark and Sweden are the other two teams in this group and got their campaigns under way earlier in Geneva, with the top two progressing to the quarter-finals, and the other two teams being eliminated

programme.title: Jonathan Ross Special Guests: Oasis
programme.desc: Ahead of their band's much-anticipated reunion, Jonathan takes a look back at the best bits from his interviews with Liam and Noel Gallagher, with the brothers' takes on their bust-up, the Oasis years, family life and, most importantly, each other

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know

programme.desc: Iceland v Finland (Kick-off 5.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the opening match of the tournament, as the Group A rivals meet at Arena Thun in Switzerland. programme.title: Lingo

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sarah from Altrincham, Jack from Sheffield, Ellie from Bedfordshire and Mo from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Portugal (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group B, held at Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. These rivals met twice this year in April in the UEFA Nations League and world champions Spain won 4-2 way and 7-1 at home to demonstrate why they were the pre-tournament favourites to win this trophy. However, they were eliminated by hosts England in the quarter-finals three years ago and their best showing in the competition remains a third-place finish in 1997. Portugal are making their third consecutive appearance in the finals having never previously qualified, but were eliminated in the group stage in both 2017 and 2022

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: When a helpless baby boy was found in Milton Keynes in 1984, staff at a nearby hospital named him after the royal baby born just a few weeks earlier. 'Harry' was adopted and raised as Jon, but he is still haunted by the mystery of his start in life, and so is foundling Tina, who was left outside a hospital in Stoke-on-Trent in 1970. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help the duo find out more about their respective families

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vets
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Geraldine and Paul from Leeds, husband and wife Patrick and Bukky from Sheffield, and spouses Stu and Kate from Wigan use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Denmark v Sweden (Kick-off 5.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Stade de Genve in Switzerland. The Scandinavian rivals were also in the same UEFA Nations League group, with Sweden winning 2-1 in Odense in February and then claiming an emphatic 6-1 victory just a month ago in Solna. They will be looking to build on that fine form as they aim to emulate their triumph in the inaugural tournament in 1984, having reached at least the quarter-finals in every staging they have qualified for since without adding another trophy to their cabinet. The Danes will look to bounce back from their recent setbacks and enjoy a tournament at least as productive as their 2017 showing in the Netherlands, when they were runners-up to the hosts

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Germany v Poland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. Germany will be looking to go one better than in 2022, when they were runners-up to hosts in England, and they go into this tournament in excellent form, having comfortably topped their UEFA Nations League group. Their opponents are playing in their first major championship, but they too go into this competition on the back of some good results in 2025, albeit without facing anyone of the calibre of the Germans. Denmark and Sweden are the other two teams in this group and got their campaigns under way earlier in Geneva, with the top two progressing to the quarter-finals, and the other two teams being eliminated

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Jonathan Ross Special Guests: Oasis
programme.desc: Ahead of their band's much-anticipated reunion, Jonathan takes a look back at the best bits from his interviews with Liam and Noel Gallagher, with the brothers' takes on their bust-up, the Oasis years, family life and, most importantly, each other

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Shazia Mirza, Lucy Porter, Curtis Walker and Tyler West join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Eddie Kadi to answer questions about black history. Jimmy Akingbola hosts

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig in his first appearance as 007. James Bond is awarded his licence to kill and sets off in pursuit of Le Chiffre, a corrupt banker who finances terrorism. Realising that the desperate Le Chiffre needs to win big on the gaming tables of Montenegro to pay off a dangerous client, Bond formulates a plan to ruin him in a high-stakes poker game.

programme.title: The Reunion
programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts Richard about the cost of his actions, he agrees to a plan to divert the police's attention from Thomas. With Max in hospital following the fallout of the night prior, Thomas meets with Fanny who reveals a dark secret. Mystery thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Dervla Kirwan and Richard Graves

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.desc: When Annabelle confronts the real Alexis, lies unravel as the truth about what happened to Vinca on that night 25 years ago is revealed. When deadly consequences arise, Thomas struggles with what his return and obsession with Vinca has done to his friends and family. Manon and Pianelli question whether justice has been served

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James cooks Korean-inspired dishes of lamb chop and mackerel, chef Chantelle Nicholson shares a delicious recipe for stuffed courgette flowers. The host also reveals how to make the perfect meringues while also treating singer Alfie Boe to a mouth-watering chicken Kyiv

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up a dish of roasted pineapple, ice cream and doughnuts while chatting to a man inspired to set up his own doughnut company when his children were diagnosed with food allergies. Chef Asma Khan provides authentic Indian cookery, and Lorraine Kelly and Marti Pellow are treated to an Arbroath smoked haddock omelette

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Mad and Josh, a mother and son from Oxford, Chelmsford twins Prabin and Pallavi, and Gail and Genny, a mother and daughter from Belfast try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sarah from Altrincham, Jack from Sheffield, Ellie from Bedfordshire and Mo from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Spain v Portugal (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group B, held at Stadion Wankdorf in Bern, Switzerland. These rivals met twice this year in April in the UEFA Nations League and world champions Spain won 4-2 way and 7-1 at home to demonstrate why they were the pre-tournament favourites to win this trophy. However, they were eliminated by hosts England in the quarter-finals three years ago and their best showing in the competition remains a third-place finish in 1997. Portugal are making their third consecutive appearance in the finals having never previously qualified, but were eliminated in the group stage in both 2017 and 2022

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: When a helpless baby boy was found in Milton Keynes in 1984, staff at a nearby hospital named him after the royal baby born just a few weeks earlier. 'Harry' was adopted and raised as Jon, but he is still haunted by the mystery of his start in life, and so is foundling Tina, who was left outside a hospital in Stoke-on-Trent in 1970. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help the duo find out more about their respective families

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by TV and radio presenter Lisa Snowdon, who ejnoys a hearty breakfast naan filled with bacon and a masala egg, Jimmy makes the most of old jeans to create an unusual feeder for the coatis at the wildlife park, and plant expert Stephan demonstrates the Japanese art of kokedama

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vets
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Geraldine and Paul from Leeds, husband and wife Patrick and Bukky from Sheffield, and spouses Stu and Kate from Wigan use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Denmark v Sweden (Kick-off 5.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Stade de Genve in Switzerland. The Scandinavian rivals were also in the same UEFA Nations League group, with Sweden winning 2-1 in Odense in February and then claiming an emphatic 6-1 victory just a month ago in Solna. They will be looking to build on that fine form as they aim to emulate their triumph in the inaugural tournament in 1984, having reached at least the quarter-finals in every staging they have qualified for since without adding another trophy to their cabinet. The Danes will look to bounce back from their recent setbacks and enjoy a tournament at least as productive as their 2017 showing in the Netherlands, when they were runners-up to the hosts

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Germany v Poland (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of both teams' opening match in Group C, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. Germany will be looking to go one better than in 2022, when they were runners-up to hosts in England, and they go into this tournament in excellent form, having comfortably topped their UEFA Nations League group. Their opponents are playing in their first major championship, but they too go into this competition on the back of some good results in 2025, albeit without facing anyone of the calibre of the Germans. Denmark and Sweden are the other two teams in this group and got their campaigns under way earlier in Geneva, with the top two progressing to the quarter-finals, and the other two teams being eliminated
